answer:
A full dose of a vaccine must be given to ensure your child is fully protected and a partial dose is considered invalid. In BC, children 4-6 years of age receive the Tetanus-Diphtheria-Pertussis-Polio (Tdap-IPV) vaccine called Adacel®-Polio or Boostrix®-Polio. You need to book with your doctor or local health unit to repeat the full dose (0.5ml) of the Tdap-IPV vaccine. Find a health unit near you here.
Immunization Nurse
question: My child is 4 years old. doc gave him quadracel injection... during injection some of the dose come out 20 to 30% should I need to half vaccination again?
question_variation_0: when i give a 4 year old quadracel injection my dose come out 20 to 30% should i need to half vaccinated again besides quadracel injection?
question_variation_2: quadracel shot when half vaccination if quadracel injection
